is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.errors

Class BondException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.errors.BuruberiException
            • is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.errors.BondException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BondException
extends BuruberiException
    Indicates that the state of a peripheral bond could not be altered by Buruberi.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • reason

        public final int reason
        The reason for the bond alteration's failure.

        This value may change between OS versions.

      • EXTRA_REASON

        @NonGuaranteed
public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_REASON
        The reason for a bond state change to have occurred.

        This extra is not publicly exposed before Android Lollipop / API Level 21, and is only partially public in API Level 21. See the SDK Android Lollipop source for the BluetoothDevice class for more info.

        See Also:
        BluetoothDevice.ACTION_BOND_STATE_CHANGED, Constant Field Values

      • REASON_UNKNOWN_FAILURE

        public static final int REASON_UNKNOWN_FAILURE

      • REASON_REMOVED

        @NonGuaranteed
public static final int REASON_REMOVED
        A bond attempt failed because the bond state of the peripheral is different from what the phone expected. On some devices, encountering this error will result in the bluetooth drivers breaking until restart.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • BondException

    • Method Detail

      • isInstabilityLikely

        public boolean isInstabilityLikely()
        Description copied from class: BuruberiException
        Several failures reported by Buruberi can either be caused by, or can cause as a side effect, Bluetooth driver instability.

        Bluetooth driver instability varies by vendor, OS Version, and device chip-set. The return value of this method should be considered a guideline, not a hard and fast rule.

        If this method returns true, it is generally a good idea to power cycle Bluetooth on the host device before trying subsequent operations.

        Overrides:
        isInstabilityLikely in class BuruberiException
        Returns:
        true if REASON_REMOVED is reported; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        for more info.
